snippet: David Cameron’s admission about Raisa the horse becomes fodder for Britons exasperated by the tabloid scandal and Scotland Yard ties.
abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron, after a week of denials, acknowledges that he had ridden a retired police horse that was lent by Scotland Yard in 2008 to Rebekah Brooks, then the editor of one of Rupert Murdoch's newspapers, while it was investigating his newspapers.
lead_paragraph: David Cameron’s admission about Raisa the horse becomes fodder for Britons exasperated by the tabloid scandal and Scotland Yard ties.

headline.seo: British Premier Changes Horse Stories Mid-Scandal
headline.main: British Premier Changes Horse Stories Mid-Scandal
headline.print_headline: Britain: Premier Changes Horse Stories In Mid-Scandal, Admits Taking a Ride
